caption: This place was really cool to visit for the first time, was a little busy but I was still able to make my way through everything and locate everything pretty easy with the signs, food court was pretty good they had some good sandwiches if you don't want to eat too much and so much pretty art

Leticia is wonderful. She assisted me with my membership. Very elegant ; well spoken, speaks perfect English and very efficient and helpful. She is an asset as the client facing person for Amis du Louvre. Ask for her to get your membership !

Very weird position. Note that the society is located in the museum, and you theoretically cannot go in if you haven't got the card, which can be obtained on site so it is really catch 22. You better order the card online and carry it when going there.  If you really don't have the time or you faced difficulties of receiving the card by post, try to communicate with the staff outside Richelieu's Gate.  Little tips that few people noticed: if you are under 26, the membership which lasts for a year, is actually cheaper than ordering one ticket online, and the same price as buying one ticket on site.  The staffs are very friendly. The site is also very quiet and comfortable.
70 000 Amis du Louvre, Friends of the Louvre, and counting!  Join now ...

Highly recommend joining the Soci√©t√© des Amis du Louvre. It's a fantastic way to support the Louvre AND skip the entrance line.  I also had great service w/my card replacement when I was in Paris (and forgot to bring my card!).

You can be a member of <> here. It is possible to be a member by internet, but it takes about a week to get it by post  and it may be lost. I recommend doing it here because you can get a card immediately. The opening time can be different from the Louvre Museum, so check it before visiting.
I made a mistake for the card but the people there are so nice and they help me to solve the problem. And of course they solve the problem right away. Thank you so much.
One of the most visited museum.. BUT!!!!! You have take care your stuff ( pursue, mobile  ) .. Be  Alert üì¢ ‚ö†Ô∏è.. inside all paintings are looks so originalS ‚Ä¶
If you plan to make multiple visits to the Louvre, consider buying an annual pass. Also reduces entry fees at a selection of other museums in Paris and elsewhere in France.

If you are planning to visit the Louvre over many, many days, look into becoming a member.
I don't know if it's related to Louvre, but I'm sure it's cool
The staff here is very helpful and nice. I got my annual pass quickly and smoothly.

The person on the phone seems keen to do the right thing but is dramatically lacking in listening skills, she systematically interrupts me, I never manage to finish asking a question and she systematically answers sideways and imprecisely to the questions I try so hard to answer. although bad to pose, but which I never managed to pose. My interlocutor seems to know better each time, and to imagine the questions I am going to ask. Oops, missing the point. It‚Äôs a shame, all this doesn‚Äôt give a very good image of the Louvre in the end.

Upon entering the office, one is warmly greeted by a dedicated team who share a common passion for art and culture. Members of the Soci√©t√© des Amis du Louvre play an essential role in supporting the museum's activities, thus enabling the preservation and enrichment of its exceptional collections.  This office offers a wealth of information on current exhibitions, special events and educational activities organized by the Soci√©t√© des Amis du Louvre. It allows visitors to become more involved in the life of the museum, to become members and to contribute to its sustainability.  In addition to its practical role, the office of the Society of Friends of the Louvre creates a spirit of community among museum enthusiasts. It is a place where people who share a love of art can meet, exchange ideas and celebrate the beauty and richness of culture together.
Since the Friends of the Louvre card does not maintain the conditions of access to the Museum for its members, it would be logical to extend its validity by 2 months. Thank you for offering it

It would have been desirable to be informed by email that reservations were obligatory between July 1 and September 8, even for members of the Friends of the Louvre... this would avoid being turned away like a dirty person.
A very beautiful museum, a lot of art in one place is amazing. The size of the facility is impressive, you can spend a pleasant day there.
It is a pity that the museum is closed today, we have learned something else, we should check it through internet technologies so that we do not come in vain ü§£ ‚Ä¶

Turned away because I didn't have a reservation even though I have a Louvre card, another stupid measure if we take cards it's to avoid this so it's the last time I take this card, obviously this museum with too much money

I loved all the things you can see! It is a shame that most of the items on display are stolen from other cultures, and there is no information, signs or a guide on where to start the tour or how to walk it! I recommend taking a guided tour.

The membership card is a scam. Almost 1 month after being debited, card still not received.  Also note that these thieves start the membership year when you pay, not when you receive your card, so you're in for several weeks.  The contact form on the site is absolutely useless, I think it doesn't even send a message, or everyone doesn't care. The operators are probably deaf because they never answer the phone.

Hello, I am reminding you once again, regarding my order of two annual subscription cards to the Louvre. I received an email on 04/10/2022 telling me to receive the card in 7 days... 22 days later, I still have not received anything, I tried to contact you by phone in vain, and no return from my previous message, I am extremely unhappy, even though the subscription was deducted from my account. Please call me back as soon as possible

I went to the Friends of the Louvre office directly at the Louvre Museum. The lady at the reception is very welcoming. She made my card and we talked throughout the process of making my subscription. Very nice welcome.

No professionalism. I ordered a Friends of the Louvre card online on November 10, but I still have not received it. I tried to contact the company via their two numbers, I even filled out the form on the site, no response.
Good welcome, good advice regarding the purchase of an annual ‚Äúfriends of the Louvre‚Äù card

It‚Äôs a labyrinth that leads to poetry. I still haven't gone around it, and I'm dreading this moment, because I would like this immensity to be endless. This place is an inestimable opportunity which provides access to the best that humans have been able to give. THANKS.
